== The secondary battery was reduced to sixteen 5"/51 caliber guns ==
Repeated sentence? [[User:CapnZapp|CapnZapp]] ([[User talk:CapnZapp|talk]]) 10:42, 5 March 2008 (UTC)
According to Beyer, the secondary armament was reduced to 16 5"L51 in 1937 and to 6 5"L51 in 1942. [[User:Naaman Brown|Naaman Brown]] ([[User talk:Naaman Brown|talk]]) 01:26, 25 February 2009 (UTC)
== Peacock-terms? ==
One segment is littered with words, I consider peacock-words, but I'm not sure. I've pasted a segment in, for your review:
"New York brought her big guns to the invasion of North Africa, providing '''crucial''' gunfire support at Safi, Morocco on 8 November 1942. She then stood by at Casablanca and Fedhala before returning home for convoy duty escorting '''critically needed''' men and supplies to North Africa. She then took up '''important''' duty training gunners for battleships and destroyer escorts in Chesapeake Bay, rendering this '''vital''' service until 10 June 1944, when she began the first of three training cruises for the Naval Academy, voyaging to Trinidad on each."
My bolds.
I'll remove them soon.--[[User:Nwinther|Nwinther]] ([[User talk:Nwinther|talk]]) 14:26, 11 May 2009 (UTC)
== Source ==
[http://books.google.com/books?id=aHZNAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA1] [[User:The ed17|Ed]] <sup>[[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]]</sup> 08:47, 19 August 2012 (UTC)
== Triple expansion? ==
I was under the impression that after the Dreadnought was launched, that all major ships without all-big-gun batteries and turbine engines were considered obsolete. Yet here we have the New York launched almost a decade later, with good old-fashioned piston engines? Didn't that have some effect on her performance? Why piston engines and not turbines? Were the designs finalized before the Dreadnought was launched? I just thought that was kind of curious. Might at least address the reasoning behind it in the article, maybe explain how she managed to keep up with other modern ships, even with a heavy and vibration-(and therefore breakage) prone powerplant.[[User:.45Colt|.45Colt]] 03:25, 9 December 2015 (UTC)
